subject: Photography
title: V-J Day in Times Square
description: A quick win: understand V-J Day in Times Square.

hook.text: A sailor grabs a nurse and kisses her in Times Square. A photographer clicks. An era ends in one frame.

buildup.text: On August 14, 1945, Japan surrendered. Celebrations erupted across New York City.

discovery.text: Alfred Eisenstaedt captured the spontaneous kiss. It became the defining image of World War II's end.

twist.text: The nurse later said the kiss was unwanted â€” the sailor was a stranger. The iconic image carries a complicated truth.

climax.text: The photo reminds us that iconic images can carry meanings their subjects never intended.

punchline.text: Every famous photo has a story behind the story.
